website_summaries.verdict: An eco-friendly way to cut your bills and cool your attic with this easy-to-install solar-powered attic fan.
pros: Pumps out a lot of heat to keep your home cooler in the summer
cons: Must have a good southern exposure for best solar charge

customer_reviews.title: Great most buy it guys
customer_reviews.text: Great product I would say it open a huge space to my roof but it pulls the air right out and this fan is quiet you wouldn’t know it’s on I would recommend buying the additional wall plug and WiFi connection with this fan. Cause at night you will need this to keep it going I am considering a battery hookup to it also
customer_reviews.author: Oneil

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Noticeably lowers the temperature in the attic. Also noticed my AC does not work as hard as it did. I have a Nest that tracks its runtime and has been lower since I installed this. Yes it is pricey but I believe after a year, it will almost have paid for itself in the money I save on electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: The best attic fan on the market.
customer_reviews.text: After a few years of having this fan I am relatively satisfied. Over the years however I noticed that the fan noise level has increased somewhat. This might be a symptom of all attic fans after a few years. Overall I like the fan and have purchased another recently.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: A few tips
customer_reviews.text: Product came quickly and packaged well. No issues there. The 20w models' solar panel does not adjust so be a little more careful with your placement. The full panel needs sun, if you cover it partially with your shadow while installing it will slow down or stop, same with cloud cover. Check all your connections BEFORE you fasten it down and seal it up. Not recommended to install in the middle of the day, hot hot hot. Otherwise, everything went in just like the instructions said it would. Time will tell if it helps my poor ac enough ha.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Murray

customer_reviews.title: This unit move a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: The unit (2nd) made a significant improvement reducing temperature in the attic and is easy to install--it's quiet and and easy to adjust the panel angle. When installing, consider that the fan immediately begins turning when exposed to sunlight--as it should. So you may want to keep the panel covered while installing to avoid injury from the spinning fan and ensure the thermostat is gently tucked into the enclosure before sliding the unit into place to avoid breakage. My attic is significantly cooler and temperature dropped about four degrees inside my home. I'm pleased with its performance so far and will write a follow up in the coming months.
customer_reviews.author: unclecozmo

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: Installation was straight forward and seem to do a good job so far on reducing the heat in the attic. I think most people do not understand what they are getting. It is solar so you need full sun and it is temperature activated. So uou have to have both for it to run. Just trying to reduce the amount of hot air. Works well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal

customer_reviews.title: Not to worry about electric bill on a monthly base!
customer_reviews.text: I believe is a great investment to any home, I got my entire roof replaced on 9-8-19, and I had the contractor take my chimney down to attic level, because I have convert my house to high efficiency no longer need a chimney. The installation process is easy since they removed chimney and just put up new sheet of plywood and they only cut a 13 inch hole for the fan opening. They fan comes on by itself and shut off. Time will tell if it fail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: My attic had no ventilation whatsoever except those tiny vents around the soffit areas I just installed it this past Sunday and now I come home every afternoon and House doesn’t feel like an oven anymore personally it’s doing the job for me and I will be adding another to the other side of my roof .
customer_reviews.author: What’s up

customer_reviews.title: Arriver needing work
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with the fan blade not securely attached to the motor. the blade had fallen down and was rubbing on the motor, when i figured out what was wrong and raised it up, the screw to tighten the fan had a stripped head so t had to replace it. The fan works good on a clear day but if there are any high clouds the fan slows way down. It seams the solar panel is maxed out for the motor.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: great for the shop
customer_reviews.text: at first I thought it didn't work but as it got more sun it really cranked up. I use it in my shop-garage and it really takes the heat out. I've ordered another one as I have a big shop. Not really advised for the home as it can actually suck conditioned air out of your home through crevices you didn't even know you had.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hutson Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Not Florida certified
customer_reviews.text: This fan is good its very solid Only issue is I live in Florida and we are required to have an NOA And it’s not Florida certified Found this out after I installed 2 of them
customer_reviews.author: ben whitehead

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I HAD MY HOUSE BLOCK WALLS FOAMED AND THE ATTIC INSULATED WITH 10 INCHES CELLULOSE. ALSO HAD ALL DUCTS SEALED. RESULT WAS NEAR MINIMAL. AFTER THAT ON 6-4-20 OUTSIDE HIGH TEMP WAS 110F AND THE LOW WAS 84F. ELECTRIC COMPANY SHOWS THAT I USED 97 KWH THAT DAY. INSTALLED THIS FAN AND NOTICED AN IMMEDIATE DROP IN POWER USAGE! FOR EXAMPLE ON 7-14-20 THE EXACT HIGH TEMPERATURE WAS 110F AND LOW WAS HIGHER AT 88F FOR THAT DAY. TOTAL KWH WAS 60! HAPPY PHOENIX CUSTOMER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Irene A.

customer_reviews.title: Moves Lots of Air Quitely
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fan. Quite and keeps the garage cool now. Installation was easy and it was not too heavy to carry up to the roof with a ladder by myself. Build quality appears to be there, and now will be the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Installing this on the roof of my house to exhaust hot air in the attic has made a huge positive difference in the temperature inside my home. The central AC was barely able to keep up with the triple digit temperature common in Texas this time of year. It was at least 10 degrees cooler in the house after the fan was installed on the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great product but don't wait to install incase any issues come up.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, well built & reliable so far. My video shows the my reason for a 4 star rating & only because everything else is top quality on these I didn't leave a 3 star rating. I would consider buying a third one despite this one annoying thing.
customer_reviews.author: A. White

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but makes a very annoying clicking sound when not full sunlight.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement fan. the old one lasted 20+ years. Easy install. No need for assembly. Works well and runs quiet in adequate sun light but makes a really annoying clicking sound when not full sunlight--especially early morning. Old fan didn't do this so I would say this is a design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Trumpet3

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I received two units. Some of the bolts and screws from one unit were loose in the box. Once the units were installed, I purchased the AC adaptor and wired to the units. The units seem to run at all times and not regulated by the Thermostat/Humidistat. The units have been running for a couple of months and are very quite and have made a difference in reducing the temperature of the upstairs bonus room.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! I bought 20 watt model, easy installation and quiet operation. Right after be installed it started to pull hot air out of my attic, before it was over 100 degrees now a little bit over 80. I ordered the Ac adapter to run it at night and definitely my house will be colder.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Significant difference!
customer_reviews.text: This fan made a noticeable difference in the comfort of the second floor of a large old home.
customer_reviews.author: mlb46227

customer_reviews.title: great fan
customer_reviews.text: fairly easy to install. the thing was throwing hot air out of the attic immediately. i can notice a difference in our top floor. no wires to run. five stars
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can install yourself.
customer_reviews.text: Like vented my attic with free energy. Still trying to see if it has made a difference keeping the attic cooled down.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Great product easy to install. Only downfall is it can't be rotated to get optimal south west exposure. Moves a lot if air. I wish it had the built in inverter like the quiet cool model.
customer_reviews.author: Neeko

customer_reviews.title: Works great very pleased with the performance
customer_reviews.text: Works great very pleased with the performance, I live in the Caribbean and have an open beam ceiling with a galvanize roof which makes the house very hot during the day when it is closed up. This fan has cooled the house down significantly, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have the solar vents.
customer_reviews.text: It hasn’t been hot enough yet to see how they work, but they look good on our home.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. It was about 45 minutes start to finish. No wiring involved. Made a big difference in my house
customer_reviews.author: LARRY CORENO

customer_reviews.title: Packaging sucks.....loose screws, washers and nuts
customer_reviews.text: Received today, and it was not put together properly, there were screws, washers and nuts all over the inside of the box not in any package and some of the screws on unit were loose...haven't had a chance to even install, but the packaging sucks
customer_reviews.author: DQ

customer_reviews.title: great vent,  very quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: The vent came very well packaged, and was constructed of heavy guage metal. Put it up when I re roofed my house and it runs very well and quietly. You get what you pay for in quality
customer_reviews.author: dave l.

customer_reviews.title: I was overdue to install a product like this. Great job.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easily installed, making a difference in my AC bill from the first week. Noticably cooler on my second floor.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Courter

customer_reviews.title: Remington Solar attic fan
customer_reviews.text: The unit has an austetic look,my attic had insufficient venting,my reason for installing the solar powered attic fan,as a cost effective solution.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vines

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to install. Quiet motor and has helped in keeping attack cooler
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey McMurry

customer_reviews.title: Attic fan
customer_reviews.text: So far so good like the fact that I have to do nothing but put it up came right on could feel the air coming out as I was installing it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quite easy to install, especially when replacing “ whirlybird “ vent...able to use same hole...
customer_reviews.text: Venting my attic. It’s too soon to know how efficient it is...just installed yesterday..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does What It Needs To
customer_reviews.text: The solar powered attic fan is working well and is much appreciated during our recent hot spell. Now, if it could only produce some rain in Southern California, that would be great. I guess we just have to settle for an improvement in the temperature and a dimunition of the HVAC bill in our house.
customer_reviews.author: VMDoland

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to help move the hot air out of my attic. The heat was actually coming in through a bathroom fan, LOTS of heat. So after I installed this the bathroom is cooler ,no heat coming in and the attic is better too. I'm thinking of getting another for the other end on the house. I bought this for two main reason, 1. Built in power no need to run 120vac to it. 2. Built in temp control, comes on when it's needed. Btw this thing is quite, I had to climb on to the roof too see if it was working and it was pulling out the heat fast.
customer_reviews.author: O1darte

customer_reviews.title: Recommend repainting and protective sealant
customer_reviews.text: The fan was a splendid addition to vent hot air but has some draw-backs. The photo shows the corrosion from a bit over two years of exposure to coastal breezes. It appears that some portions were more resistant than others because the brackets almost disappeared from rust and allowed the fan to fall all the way down. The other matter involved the thermostat. Two failed for reasons unknown. Do more research and spend the money for aluminum housings and stainless steel supports like a Solar Attic Fan should have.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM S SANDERS

customer_reviews.title: Motor does not last and Warranty coverage is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this SF30-BLK unit back in April of 2019 and had it professionally installed in May. after just a few months the motor died. I have the inverter and verified with my multi-meter that i'm getting power from the solar cells and the inverter. I figured since it has a "Lifetime" parts warranty I should easily be able to get a swap out for the motor, but apparently if you don't register within 30 days of purchase the warranty is not valid..... yeah stay away from this one folks
customer_reviews.author: CibboMatteo

customer_reviews.title: Works good but doesn't turn off - cheap junk - failed after a few weeks - no support
customer_reviews.text: The fan works well but it never shuts off. I have the unit that is solar with the 110 adapter. It will switch to AC if there is not enough sun. I have a separate temperature/humidity sensor in the attic near the fan and even when it is well below 80 degrees F and well below 75% humidity the fan still runs. I bought directly from the Remington Solar website. Edit - changed to one star because it completely stopped working after only a few weeks and support is unresponsive. I am left with a $370 paper weight. Bought in June, failed in July
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This solar fan installed easily. It is over our garage which gets extremely hot in the summer. Since we have a few battery operated items including my car I wanted to control the heat and humidity. While it is still spring where we are, the fan has started to operate on days when the ambient temp is over 70 and the garage roof temp is over 80 F. The fan runs only when the temperature gets to those levels otherwise it stays off. So far so good and I would recommend the fan. I will try to post and update once we are through summer.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Chungath

product_meta.title: 20-Watt Solar Attic Fan (Black) with Thermostat / Humidistat (22 x 22 x 11 IN) - Brushless Motor – Hail and Weather Resistant Solar Vent Fan – Solar Powered Attic Fan for Homes - by Remington Solar
product_meta.description:
Size:20 Watt| Color:Black

COOL YOUR ATTIC AND HOME… SAVE ON ELECTRIC BILLS… EASE YOUR HVAC / FURNACE’S STRESS: Attics can reach up to 140+ Degrees in the summer months; it’s no wonder you dread paying your energy bill during July… Remington Solar could EASILY lower your energy consumption!

This solar powered roof fan ventilates your attic utilizing FREE Solar Power, which cools your home AND takes the load off your HVAC/Furnace… Saving you THOUSANDS over time!



BUILT-IN HUMIDISTAT / THERMOSTAT: Whether its humid or a dry climate, this fan was made for your home! Its Humidistat and Thermostat allow it to automatically fight Moisture or Heat based on its readings!



BRUSHLESS MOTOR TO EXTEND THE FAN’S LIFE… TEXAS WINDSTORM CERTIFIED: No more brush replacements for your outdated attic fan… This Solar Roof Vent features a brushless motor, which turns the motor without wear or friction, extending the life of your fan! This fan is also Texas Windstorm Certified!



ADD-ON AVAILABLE TO AUTOMATICALLY SWITCH POWER SOURCE AND OPERATE AT NIGHT: Most solar attic vents “claim” to have a 110v inverter to run the fan at night… except YOU have to climb up and MANUALLY switch the fan!

Remington Solar’s 110v Hybrid Adapter (SOLD SEPARATELY) Automatically detects low power from your panel, while checking the temperature of your attic to determine if it should run on house power!



30-DAY SATISFACTION GUARANTEE AND LIFETIME LIMITED WARRANTY: We’re so confident in this Solar Powered Fan for Attics we’re giving you a 30-day RISK-FREE TRIAL, on top of a 15-year warranty! If you don’t like it simply send it back and we’ll refund every cent!

** CAN VENTILATE 1,800 SQ. FT.**

All parts included:

 * Solar Panel
 * Fan with Housing
 * Humidistat/Thermostat
 * Hinges
 * Mounting Screws
feature_bullets: REDUCES YOUR ENERGY BILL… COOLS YOUR ATTIC & HOME… IMPROVES HVAC & FURNACE PERFORMANCE: Summer months bring higher energy bills, partly because of the limited airflow into your Attic! This solar roof-vent fan Cools attics & Automatically keeps your Home Cooler… taking the stress off your Furnace, HVAC & your Wallet!

POWERED BY FREE SOLAR ENERGY… FIGHTS MOLD & MOISTURE: Finding Mold & Moisture in your home can cause severe consequences to your home’s value and your family’s health. This solar exhaust fan is fueled by the Sun & Automatically Combats Mold & Moisture!

BUILT-IN HUMIDISTAT & THERMOSTAT… HYBRID ADAPTER TO RUN AT NIGHT (SOLD SEPERATELY): Heat & Moisture damage your attic & can create HUGE repair bills… Remington Solar’s roof ventilation fan includes a Humidistat & Thermostat to automatically change airflow based on your attic’s needs! In addition, it can also be fitted with our Hybrid Adapter (Sold Separately) to Run at Night!

LIFE-EXTENDING, BRUSHLESS MOTOR… LITTLE-TO-NO-NOISE… HAIL & WEATHER RESISTANT: This Brushless Motor creates no friction & turns your motor without wear, giving your solar roof fan a longer life! It’s also near-inaudible & comes with a Texas Windstorm Document!

DESIGNED FOR A LIFETIME OF USE… 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: You have nothing to lose! Simply try our solar powered ventilation fan & if for any reason you aren't satisfied, we'll refund EVERY penny within 30-days! We also back the Fan with a limited Lifetime Warranty!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars85 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
